comment: Dr. Aust is the best teacher I've ever had. He is so personal and caring with his students. There are 4 tests, 2 papers (easy), and online homework that you need to buy a code for (about 1 quiz a week). He provides practice questions over each chapter and the tests are usually the same as the practice so as long as you study those you'll get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Four exams including the final. Most work is done on Pearson. You will have to purchase the code to access the homework. Online quizzes due maybe once a week but nothing that can't be handled. Good teacher. Will do group work in class. Always emails what material is covered in class in case you missed it. Very forgiving and helpful. Cool dude.

Professor Aust is hands down the greatest professor I have had. He is very straight forward with what he expects from his students and is extremely easy to approach. He genuinely cares about all of his students, not just in the classroom but your life outside of his class as well. I would highly suggest him to everyone.

Professor Aust is probably the best professor that I've ever had. I loved his class and the passion he showed for it. He is an extremely kind man and truly goes above and beyond for his students. If you truly make an effort to study for each test you will be fine.

Dr. Aust is the BEST professor in the world. He actually cares about his students. just do the work and you'll pass. There's actually not much work in this class. 3 papers, 1 is literally an "about me" paper, the other is a reflection paper and the other a Lit review. He is very easy to talk to and won't make you feel dumb. Take him!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Dr. Aust is amazing. He genuinely cares about his students and he LOVES what he teaches. You can tell as soon as he begins talking about it. His tests are challenging, but if you study the book and his lecture notes, you will do fine. Tries to make his lectures interesting and he loves it if the class participates. 10/10 I'd take again. A+

Dr. Aust is a great professor & really cares about students. It is so easy to get an A in his class - IF you attend lectures & spend time studying for the exams. Tests will be super hard if you haven't learned key terms & concepts, but otherwise really fun & easy course, just make sure to set aside time for studying. Gives pop quiz for extra credit
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Aust is extremely accommodating to his students. He is, by far, one of the most caring and kind human beings Ive ever encountered. His tests seem tricky, but if you really pay attention in class and to the readings, its not bad. Dont be afraid to talk to him if you feel youre falling behind. I would take him again in a heartbeat!

I have never dropped a class except I had to drop this one. Professor Aust is very nice, but his lectures are all over the place and unorganized. The tests are extremely difficult to do well on, multiple choice, T &F with written corrections and a long fill in the blank section. This is a C-D average class based on tests. I wouldn't recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Aust is the nicest man EVER! He's so smart, & he truly cares about his students. His tests can be difficult if you don't prepare, but if you read each chapter once & review his chapter outlines, you'll make an A. He offers a ton of extra credit too, so I've made over a 100 on each exam so far! Plus the theories are so interesting! Take him!

Good professor and he really does care for his students. I struggled on his tests a good bit.  I did well on the final, but that was because I changed my study habits. I found towards the end studying the lecture notes thoroughly and reading the chapter was better for me. Dr. Aust is very willing to help and clarify questions.

Dr. Aust gave advice to read each chapter twice, and study his class notes for each test. I followed and got an A. He has to be the nicest guy ever. He brought snacks to our final and was flexible with our schedules when it came to our paper due date. He also offered a TON of extra credit when he saw students were struggling. I highly recommend!

I loved this class with Dr. Aust. He really cares about the subject. His lectures can be lengthy and he takes awhile to explain some pretty simple things but I attribute that to his love for the subject. He really cares about his students too. This class in NOT easy but it's also a senior level class so don't expect it to be, try and you'll pass.
Great professor. Super nice guy, and genuinely cares for his students' well-being. I'd gladly take him again if given the opportunity.

Dr Aust is the best! Take him & you won't regret! Rarely went to class & when I talked to him he just wanted to make sure I was ok & told me life happens. He wanted to make sure that it wasnt his fault. Truth is I loved it. He's funny & easy! Just make sure you understand what he expects for papers. Show up class before tests. Taking theory class!
rating_tags: Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Honest review from student who does the min. Dr. Aust is easily the most caring, flexible, fair, kind, easy, & interesting I have had & I've had some of the best. He is constantly looking to better his class by getting feedback from students while also giving feedback. He wants to make the class fun. talks in funny voices sometimes. Def take him!

Did not really learn much from his lectures. Tests were decent if you studied the notes he provided. Gives bonus points every now and then. A few easy papers, and 2 exams. I would recommend taking him.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I have never filled one of these ouf before but I after taking this class I had to. Dr. Aust is a very intelligent professor, but when it comes to his lectures they are so all over the place.. not to mention you are to read several chapters multiple times to prepare for what are the most unclear tests I've ever seen. Pick another prof. If you can!

If you have the chance to take Aust, take him! He is very understand and will work with you if you just ask. I had a lot of personal issues this semester and had to miss a lot of class, but he was completely sympathetic and even reached out to make sure I was doing okay. He really cares and whats his students to succeed!

Dr. Aust is a great professor. I learned so much from his class. Attendance isn't mandatory but he gives practice questions and tells you exactly what's on the test so go to class! He gives bonus quizzes and offers bonus on every test. Ur grade is made up of 4 tests & 1 paper. Go to class and study hard and you'll be fine! Would take him again.
Great, fun teacher! Definitely take him!! Work load is not too much and he's very flexible and caring with all the students!

Great class. Non-Cumulative final. Attendance not required, I recommend going b/c he tells you what he expects. Yes his tests are hard (SOMETIMES), but there really aren't any surprises. Everything on the test is in his lecture. He gives extra credit on EVERY test and even bonus quizzes. This is an upper level class so it's going to be hard to bs.
The questions he gives after class are on the test. This class was intersted but very hard. Read everything before class. I would buy the book.

You will need to read the book at least 3 times before the test. He expects you to be able to fill in the blank quotes from the book. His test was the most insane thing I've ever seen. The average grade of the first test for the class was a "D",  yet he sent out an email to the class blaming us, saying we all needed better study habits. RUN AWAY!

You'll have to really study to make an A in Dr. Aust's class, but he will always work with you and be understanding of any problems you encounter while taking the course. - Awesome guy with a great personality, and a true heart for teaching students about communication.

Dr. Aust is an amazing professor. I read all of these former posts about hard tests, etc. However, I have had a much different experience. Test material is very clear: The notes he provides, the notes you take in class, and at least skim the chapters. Attendance is optional, but go bc he says what's going to be on the test. Take him! He's very kind

Who the heck has time to read each chapter 3 times before a test?! He needs to realize this is NOT our only class and most students have jobs on top of that. His tests are the hardest I've ever taken. Excuse me if I can't remember every quote word for word for your stupid fill in the blank tests. Impossible!

His test are HARD, better read the book, at least twice. He will expect you to be able to fill in the blank, quote it on tests.  4 tests, no extra credit. His entire class  averaged a 67 on exam 1, and he responded it must be our fault for not studying enough. (I have a 3.5 GPA. I study a lot) When a professor blames his ENTIRE class. AVOID HIM

Alright, this professor is awesome. Is he difficult, YES. Is this class impossible, NO. Just read the chapters 2 times before the test and make sure to right down important phrases for fill in the blank questions on the test. This professor loves what he does and truely cares about his students and is more than willing to help and knows his stuff.

He may make you quote lines word for word on short answer test Q's, but considering he posts lecture notes that are bolded with what he wants you to remember, it's kind of hard to not do well. No need to read book, read his notes. Read before class- he gives bonus quizzes 6-10X a semester and you can improve test grades by at least a letter grade.

Class is only 3 exams. Hated going to class everyday, he's a great guy, but not a good teacher. Definitely goes on too many unrelated rants. Subject material is irrelevant and not captivating at all. I'm  a senior, I have a 3.6 GPA and normally love all my classes. Not this one. Please, if you're a patient person, fine, your decision, your regret.

I took this class in Spring of 2013, and it was the last class I had to take in major. Aust made the class interesting to go to especially since it was on a Friday. The tests were hard but if you studied enough and read enough you would get a good grade. Also, he offers many opportunities for extra credit.

You can't avoid this professor, since he teaches most Com Theory/Media Capstone classes now. Be ready to read the book at least 3 times to get every quote, etc. right. I would attend classes. I'm one to take extra notes when reading, but he isn't clear over what the exam is over so you'll feel like you're left in the dark. Good luck getting an A.

Aust is a nice, but his class is tough. His test will cover 1-2 chapters but he expects you to be able to quote anything from the book/notes on the test. (Fill in the blank from the book/notes). I normally don't study but had to read the book multiple times, make notes, etc. and only managed a B. Nice guy, just makes it harder than it needs to be
Com Theory was boring and it would have been better if the professor stuck to lecturing and not the side stories that did not matter when it came to test time. He does not use his time wisely.

I am taking Dr. Aust right now and I am really enjoying it. He is not an easy teacher but he is totally willing to help you. One thing I really appreciate that may seem random is that he takes the time to learn your name. He provides notes on Vista and in class worksheets, which is primarily what tests are based off of but you will need the book as well! Read the chapters multiple times to really absorb it! But overall thumbs up.

I took this course with 2 professors on a Frid, I made a B. He is somewhat boring, very specific and somewhat obsessive (OCD) regarding instructions. This should have been an interesting an fun course, but creativity was limited.  I was disappointed in the class.  I would not take another class from this professor

I took it's only offering of Friday for like a billion hours. Needless to say, I didn't go to class. The projects are easy, the quizzes suck. I bet if I had bought the book and studied I'd fly right through the course. Very, very easy though. They take attendance- but it's not apart of course grade.

Very easy class. I had it fridays with 2 instructors. It was easy and the tests were very easy as well. THe projects are very easy. They follow the book exactly and post the powerpoints online so going to class is somewhat pointless.

Very lively and enthusiastic about what he teaches, but very nerdy about it.  His grading methods are very hit-or-miss.  If you don't do exactly what he wants/expects (even on the opinion papers), he'll bomb them in red ink.  Tests are near impossible without reading the chapters cover to cover.

His tests are the toughest I've ever taken. The multiple choice, matching and true/false aren't bad, it's just a lot to remember. The fill in the blanks is a different story. They're tough. A lot of test questions come from the study guide, but make sure you read through the chapters at least twice.
Too much outside work!!!You can barely get his stuff finished. He forgets you have other classes. He is boring.He tries hard but he is just not conntecting with the class.
No Comments
No Comments
dont take him
very nice guy, but VERY picky on tests. Asks irrelevent questions on tests/exams

Fun class...no lectures, just daily homework and class discussions. He's is very particular with grading assignments. Follow all of the directions exactly and ask questions if needed. Very cool teacher.
Great teacher!  He is always available if you need help.
Easy class if you go. No lecture, just discussions and homework.
